title: Bladder Diary by iUFlow
description:
iUFlow app is a bladder diary on your mobile. Download to track and monitor toilet trips.
"Bladder diary by iUFlow" is a fully automated voiding and stool diary. 4.8‚≠ê
It is FREE and UNLIMITED Toilet diary üöΩ 
(also known as incontinence tracker üöæ,
pee log ‚úî bladder runpee and stool log üßª).

Urine tracker enables the recording of intake and output (urine). Trace your Bladder activities, as well as recording bowel movement - poo - using a Bristol chart (normal, constipation, diarrhea etc) for a digestive tracker and poo journal. 

Keep track of your bladder and bowel movements easily on your phone, then easily share the diary with your doctor. A complete urine log or a bathroom log is a basic source of data for treatment and will be very appreciated by your health provider. 

Some use iUFlow bladder diary as a comfortable water/urine reminder during the time of completing a 72hr urination bladder diary.
The app further allows the automation of the urine measurement by using the iUFlow device which is an optional item.
 
The iUFlow device is currently for selected clinics and can be pre-ordered.

A detailed BD may be important and useful for health issues related to prostate enlargement, renal failure, kidney transplant, urinary incontinence, Lower Urinary Tract symptoms (LUTS).

recentChanges:
Thanks for using iUFlow. Your support is appreciated!

We're listening to your feedback and working hard to improve iUFlow. Here is what's been added to the latest version:
- Removed permission requests
- Better support for night monitoring - incl. option to mark First morning pees and show Nocturia parameters
- poo log + pee log = full toilet tracking
- Improved performance and stability
- Customize drink volumes
- Bad bugs control


Please let us know what you think!
comments: I was asked to keep a track of my intake of liquids and record when I go to the toilet by a health professional to see what is causing me issues. This app allows you to record when and what you drink and also if you leak and how urgent it is to need to go to the toilet. This app will be good to maintain and monitor that going forward.

This app was able to help me see the potential health problems I was haven that went unnoticed before! After about 2 months of recording, I was able to visit my doctor with documentation when trying to explain my symptoms. Along with a food/exercise tracking app installed around the same time along with good record keeping, my doctor was able to pinpoint my exact cause of symptoms and was able to point me in the right direction for overall better personal health care!!!

Exactly what I needed. Extremely simple. No ridiculous bells and whistles that only a physician would need. My only request would be an easier way to get back from the diary to an entry and reverse. A little old school to have to back out of one to get to the other. Great job. Please keep it simple guys ...too many over complicated over thought apps out there.

Easy to record urine flow and liquid intake. Just enter the volume and your observations. Time of the activity is automatically recorded. Keeps a time wise diary which can be exported by pdf to a mail ID. It will help you and your doctor to monitor any issues. Very easy to use.

Very effective and easy to use. I am not sure I would say I love using it to track all bladder movements, but if you need to do this, this is definitely the no-nonsense, easy-to-use tool to do it. Data export is easy and effective, allowing you the opportunity to throw real data back at your urologist. Oz to ml conversions on the fly, drink size presets, and ability to note characteristics for each entry are features I use. This app owns.

title: SeniControl
description:
Micturition Diary is a very practical tool to observe your bladder weakness. 
You just need to enter solid information on daily meals and liquid intake, amount of urine loss, bladder weakness episodes & changing of absorbent products to an get product recommendations that will help you to deal with incontinence. 
It will only take 3 days to find an effective solution. 
Just fill in your profile details and start using Micturition Diary today. Find out more options in Seni Control App: 
- full control of your day
- Micturition Diary can be kept for a close person with incontinence  
- full reports can be sent on your email 
- programme of exercises strengthening pelvic floor muscles 
- answers to many questions on incontinence

Sorry - I could not get passed the 2nd screen; so I could not enter the programme.

title: UriTrack
description:
UriTrack is an app which enables you to log your urinary events (urination, leaks and urges). This is a replacement for a voiding log or a voiding diary that is often used in diagnostics of various urinary problems.

This app allows you to check your recorded events and modify them. You can also view charts with various statistics related to your recorded data. You can also export your data and import it in another device.

The developer does not collect nor does he have have access to the data you input in the app.
descriptionHTML:
UriTrack is an app which enables you to log your urinary events (urination, leaks and urges). This is a replacement for a voiding log or a voiding diary that is often used in diagnostics of various urinary problems.

This app allows you to check your recorded events and modify them. You can also view charts with various statistics related to your recorded data. You can also export your data and import it in another device.

The developer does not collect nor does he have have access to the data you input in the app.
summary: An app that serves as a voiding log or diary.
recentChanges: Latest update added a new event type for catheter voiding as well as few new analytics options.
comments: Very useful app, I had a catheter fitted due to spinal disc damage and was looking for an app to record my urine output and came across this one. It is perfect, and you can print out your records! A+++++

Very very good and useful all, I have just had a kidney transplant last week and got home from hospital 2 days ago, and I have to measure my input and output, not yet tried exporting the data but hope itll go in to excel so I can add all the necessary hospital ID numbers and name and what not so when I go to clinic for check up I can print it off and show them, I'm 26 so it far better to have this all on a app instead of using pen and paper so I thank you for an amazing app
Horrible UI. Hard to tell there are tabs at the top. Nothing is clearly marked. Total guess as to how to use it. Great concept, however. I might make an app of my own that does this.

Seems like a very useful app. I would definitely use it if it had a urine collection unit (hat) that used dcl as the measurement, but I don't (mine is in ml). Will reinstall if it ever includes that feature. Converting ml to dcl every time, in order to use the app, wont work for me. UPDATE: Changed rating to 5 stars. The ability to add liquid in ml is just what I needed. Thanks, developers, for doing that! Excellent app!
The best app ever to track your fluid intake and bladder void volume. Thumps up to the developer. You are a gem buddy.

title: U Flow Bladder Diary
description:
Measure the force of your Pee using Sound!! Dramatic low-cost approach to monitoring your own waterworks. Measure your urine flow at home instead of the Doctor's office. Many recordings instead of one. Turn your Urologist appointment into a Virtual visit, save time and money!!
U Flow is a "Bladder Diary" or a a"Voiding Journal" app. Its goal is to record your drinks and urinations to show the actual state of your urinary problem. It works for older men with prostate issues, children with voiding disorders and also women with incontinence problems. There is no extra hardware, we measure the urine flow by sound using the mic in your phone!
Drinks are picked from a short list of neutral or urologically active drinks and represent your intake of water.
The outflow is small, medium or large or exactly 427ml. You can record leaks and urgency as well. The urine flow rate tracing is make by analyzing the SOUND it makes as if falls into the water in the toilet. The shape and duration of this tracing is very indicative of how well you are peeing.

 Using digital signal processing this app converts the SOUND of your urination to a graphical tracing, just like the doctor office instrument. You can do a Uroflowmeter test for every pee for several days. And record your drinks too, to offer your doctor a clear and helpful picture of your urological health status.

The app captures the drinks and urinations of whole days. These are stored on the phone, and sent to the anonymous database when you press Save. Swipe up and down views the activity at time of day, Swipe left and right moves to different days.

Please note that we go to great trouble to Not Know your name n

or email. The app is truly anonymous. We really do not know who you are!

The published Patient Trial is available in the app.
Some more details about the IPSS Questionnaire
comments: Great app. I came across this app by accident and decided to give it a try. The app is easy to use and navigate. It would be useful however if there was a remove button to delete any erroneous readings, so as not to corrupt the data and overall report. I noticed recently that the app frequently crashes when scrolling from right to left, which is annoying and sometimes during recording events. I also noticed that the duration time stated to the left of the graph and time on the x-axis don't match

when tapping recording or demo it exits! On installation I gave it permission since it was logical to and I just checked into app configuration to be shure: it is enabled! By exiging it gracefully will not solve the problem ...
I LOVE THIS APP

title: Pelvic Floor First
description:
The Pelvic Floor First app is designed for people at risk of or experiencing pelvic floor dysfunction, who want to get back into exercise or keep exercising. Many standard exercises can place increased pressure on the pelvic floor muscle, leading to stress incontinence during exercise, or increasing the risk of incontinence.

Pelvic Floor First aims to encourage exercises that put less pressure on the pelvic floor, to reduce the risk of bladder and bowel problems

Features:
- Create customised workouts
- Explanatory videos and step-by-step instructions for exercises
- Save your favourites
- Links and further information
- Share the app

Common signs that can indicate a pelvic floor problem include:
‚Ä¢ leaking urine when you exercise, laugh, cough or sneeze
‚Ä¢ needing to hurry to the toilet or not making it there in time
‚Ä¢ constantly needing to go to the toilet
‚Ä¢ finding it difficult to empty your bladder or bowel
‚Ä¢ accidentally losing control of your bladder or bowel
‚Ä¢ a prolapse
‚Ä¢ pain in your pelvic area, or
‚Ä¢ painful sex

Incontinence can be prevented, cured or better managed by following the right advice. Anyone experiencing any of the above symptoms should seek advice from a health professional or call the National Continence Helpline on 1800 33 00 66 to speak with a continence nurse advisor. The Continence Foundation recommends people embarking on an exercise program should first consult with a health professional.

ABOUT
The Continence Foundation of Australia is the national peak body for continence awareness, management, education, research and advocacy in Australia.

For more information visit pelvicfloorfirst.org.au or continence.org.au.

PLEASE NOTE
Please ensure you allow the app data access as videos will be downloaded when you first watch them.

Very useful app I am a nephrotic patient so I have to keep my records of urine and water I just loved this app
very helpful for creating awareness about your problem and help you take control of your urination

title: Overactive Bladder Symptom Score - Urine Tracker
description:
"Overactive Bladder Symptom Score - Urine Tracker" is a mobile app that uses Overactive Bladder Symptom Score (OABSS) questionnaire for evaluation of overactive bladder (OAB). OAB is a common symptom syndrome with urgency, urinary frequency, and urgency incontinence. OABSS questionnaire in "Overactive Bladder Symptom Score - Urine Tracker" app was designed to quantify OAB symptoms. OABSS questionnaire contains questions that address four symptoms of OAB, namely daytime frequency, nighttime frequency, urgency, and urge incontinence.

There are several features of "Overactive Bladder Symptom Score - Urine Tracker", namely:
üî∏ Simple and very easy to use.
üî∏ Precise calculation with OABSS questionnaire.
üî∏ Quantification of OAB symptoms.
üî∏ It is totally free. Download now!

The OABSS has a maximum score of 15 with more weight assigned to urgency and urgency incontinence symptom. OABSS is found to be reliable and valid questionnaire and highly responsive to treatment related fluctuations in OAB symptoms. This tool is also recommended in women with OAB for evaluation after drug treatment. Repeating the test after an acceptable treatment interval is an effective way to assess the efficacy of a particular drug regimen on OAB symptoms. Download "Overactive Bladder Symptom Score - Urine Tracker" now!

Disclaimer: All calculations must be re-checked and should not be used alone to guide patient care, nor should they substitute for clinical judgment

title: Bedwetting Diary Free
description:
Bedwetting Diary is for storing daily records of child's behavior for the treatment.
You can manage one or more children separetly and see all the records with a table sheet. Switch the table display to daily, weekly and monthly.
Just tapping behavior icons to store records. It is so simple. Dry and wet icons will be displayed on the calendar so you can understand the behaivor at a glance.
You can send the table sheet as a CSV file by email and retrieve data in a spreadsheet software.		
ÔºäBedwetting Diary does not sync with Google Calendar.	

Bedwetting Diary Howto Guide

ÔºäMenu Button of the PhoneÔºä
1. Search:Search the records by a keyword.
2. Import SD card: Import data from SD card.
3. Export SD card: Export data to SD card.
4. Export Cloud:You can backup data to Google Drive and Dropbox.ÔºäPlease install either software from the market.
6. Copy to SD card: Copy the data to internal and external SD card.
7. Password: Set the password.
8. Recovery: Use this function when you want to return to the previous data. ÔºäPlease note that the current data will be deleted when you use this function.

ÔºäAdd child namesÔºä
You can save one or more child names and manage the records separately for each child.
1. Launch Enuresis Diary. Opening screen is "Add" window.
2. Enter the name, select a photo, sex and birthday‚Üítap "Save" and return to the calendar.
3. You can add more names, edit and select the name by tapping the top-right square button of the calendar. 
4. Selected child name is displayed on the title bar.

ÔºäHow to save daily recordsÔºä
1. Tap Ôºã ("Add") button of the calendar.
2. Move to Daily To-Do.
„Éº„ÉºAction Tag„Éº„Éº
3. Action tag is selected. Tap behavior icons to save records.
4. Let's save first "Dry" or "Wet"  for the day. The seleted icon from those will be displayed on the calendar so that you can understand the behavior at a glance.
5. Save records by tapping each icon. After saving records, the saved data will be appeared below the calendar.
6. A long press to edit the behavior icons. Move to edit window.
ÔºúEdit window's buttonsÔºû
Pencil buttonÔºöAfter editing all the data tap pencil button to save.
Back buttonÔºöReturn to Daily To-Do.
Delete buttonÔºöDelete the behavior icon.
„Éº„ÉºCondition Tag„Éº„Éº
1. Tap Condition tag.
2. Sleeping hours will be calculated when there are entries of wake-up and bed time.
3. Tap face marks to save bed time mood of the child.
4. You can use a memo as a journal.
5. Return to the calendar by pressing „ÄåBack„Äçbutton of the mobile phone.

ÔºäButtons of the calendarÔºä
From top
---top right---
1. „ÄåHelp„Äçbutton: Move to this description web page of GalleryApp.
2. „ÄåMarket„Äçbutton:ÔºöRecommendation of other GalleryApp's apps.
---below Help and Market button---
3. „ÄåAdd„ÄçbuttonÔºöAdd, edit and select the name of the child.
---middle right of the calendar---
4. „ÄåList„Äçbutton: Switch to a list display.
5. „ÄåWeekly„Äçbutton: Switch to a weekly display.
---middle of the calendar---
6. „ÄåArrow„ÄçÔºöSwitch the display. You can see the list in a full screen.
Bottom of the calendar
---from left^---
7. „ÄåAdd„ÄçbuttonÔºöSave daily records of the child.
8. „ÄåToday„Äçbutton: Go back to today's date.
9. „ÄåLeft„Äç„ÄåRight„Äçbutton: Move dates right and left.„ÄÇ
10.„ÄåGraph„ÄçbuttonÔºöYou can see graphs of each behavior.
11. „ÄåTable„ÄçbuttonÔºöYou can see the data with table sheet.

ÔºäTable sheetÔºä
RowÔºöDate
ColumnÔºöTime
---From top row---
1. Dry or Wet of the day.
2. The sum of urination he/she holded.
3. Time line.
4. The sum of wake up urination.
5. The sum of diaper urination.
6. The sum of diaper and wake up urination (Night time urination).
7. The sum of the total urination.
8. Hospital vists records.
---Bottom buttons---
From left
1. Move to the previous day, week and month.
2. Switch the display to daily, weekly and monthly.
3. Move to the next day, week and month.
ÔºäIn the table sheet screen, press "Menu" button of the mobile. You can send the table sheet as a CSV file by email and retrieve data in a spreadsheet software.

title: Incontinence Help
description:
Would you like to have control of your body again, gain confidence, relax, achieve your work duties and social goals!

With this app, we have compiled ancient remedies for incontinence. We give you only the successful ones. Here is the table of contents:

--What is incontinence?
--Herbal cures
--Traditional home and folk remedies
--Chinese herbal cures
--Ayurveda
--Homeopathic remedies
--Bach Flower remedies
--Diet

How to use this app?

There are three important buttons:

-- Your Therapy

-- Symptoms

-- Description of remedies 

First tap on Symptoms and then tap on one or more icons that say Add to Your Therapy. You will see a short message ("toast") that the symptom is entered into the therapy.

You can select all symptoms that you want now or later, it does not matter. Once entered, you will be able to delete the chosen symptom with a click of a button.

Then tap on various groups of remedies. Typically, these will be Homeopathy, Bach Flower remedies, Ayurveda and others. Visit these therapies and tap on icon to select the remedy and enter it into the chosen therapy.

Finally, tap on Your Therapy. You will see a list of symptoms (in orange) mixed with a list of remedies (green) that you have selected. Taken together, the symptoms and the remedies form your therapy. Now all you have to do is obtain the remedies and start the process of eventual improvement of your health.

The whole process takes less than five minutes but will cut down the time to search for remedies. We have chosen only the proven remedies from various types of healing so let this be a firm base for further research of yours. In the meantime, you undertook the first step towards the change of your life.

If the symptoms change, you may repeat the entire process.

The app is free and is supported by (hopefully non intrusive) ads. This app belongs to a wider group of apps that may be able to help you improve your health. Please visit the option Other apps to see what else do we have.

title: SimBex
description:
Incontinence is a growing health and social problem that is not yet sufficiently addressed. The prevalence of incontinence ranges from 5 to 10 percent of the population and according to some data, as many as 20 percent of them are people over 35 years of age. Although incontinence more often affects multiparas and the elderly, children and men are no exception when it comes to this health problem.

25 years ago, we were the first to talk openly about incontinence. Since then, we are determined in providing quality to our users. Through our expertise, individual approach and kind words of understanding, we educate about the quality of life.

 

We want to facilitate access to tips and information, which can help in preventing the incontinence, discovering its causes, and finding the right aids. That is why we created the SimBex mobile app - to make our experience, tips, and assistance available with one click, from the comfort of your own home.

SimBex mobile application is created for each user who is facing the incontinence problem, as well as for their families - to gain a better insight in this health problem and to be able to provide understanding and support to the person who is facing the incontinence. Application is also intended for those who are not suffering from incontinence problem, but they want to know more about its prevention.

Incontinence is a problem, which if properly taken care of, does not have to be an obstacle in life.

Providing a high-quality help for someone who is facing incontinence, means greatly improving the quality of his life.

title: kegel exercises
description:
Kegel exercises can help make the muscles under the uterus, bladder, and bowel (large intestine) stronger. Kegel App can help strengthen your pelvic floor muscles. This can help you manage or prevent physical problems such as incontinence. Incontinence is leakage of urine (pee) or stool (poop) that you can‚Äôt control.
Kegel exercises can also help improve your sexual health and pleasure by:
Relaxing your vaginal muscles, which lets your vagina be more open. This is helpful if you have pain during sexual intercourse, pelvic exams, or both.
Improving blood circulation to your vagina and pelvic floor. This can help increase sexual arousal.
Making it easier for you to reach orgasm.
Increasing vaginal lubrication (wetness).
Kegel App can help both men and women who have problems with urine leakage or bowel control. 
You may have these problems:

    As you get older
    If you gain weight
    After pregnancy and childbirth
    After gynecologic surgery (women)
    After prostate surgery (men)
Kegel exercises can be done any time you are sitting or lying down. You can do them when you are eating, sitting at your desk, driving, and when you are resting or watching television.

title: Indian Oil Tanker Truck Simulator Offroad Missions
description:
Oil tanker fuel cargo is a specialized driving game in which you will learn how to drive and control heavy trucks and tankers. Show your skills in transporting fuel from factory to stations on heavy oil tankers, your first and primary duty is to maintain fuel supply over mountains, hills and city areas. What you have to do is fill your oil tanker from oil factory and drive to deliver extreme incendiary gasoline fuel to different off-road gas stations and city stations within the time period to meet the demand of petrol and diesel. Take extra driving maintenance and accuracy while driving this heavy duty of oil truck transporter. When you start this game you forget all other games like (desert jeep racing, farming tractor, bus simulation, train simulator) when you download this game.

Game Features :

- Different environment of oil stations. 
- Extreme precision 3D truck simulation.
- Great energetic and smooth gameplay.
- Clock is ticking so transport oil on limited time.
Awesome multiple driving controls of truck.

title: Pelvic Floor Trainer - Kegel Exercises
description:
When it comes to your gym routine, exercises that strengthen your pelvic floor muscles probably aren't at the top your list. But they should be. A stronger pelvic floor will help reduce your risk of incontinence, improve your sexual health, and boost your core strength and stability.

Kegel exercises can help you prevent or control urinary incontinence and other pelvic floor problems. Start doing Kegel exercises correctly.

Pelvic Floor Exercises, also known as Kegel exercises, are essential to every woman‚Äôs exercise routine and they can be done anytime, anywhere, and without anyone noticing.

Pelvic floor muscle exercises can help:
- improve bladder and bowel control
- reduce the risk of prolapse
- improve recovery from childbirth and gynaecological surgery (in women)
- improve recovery after prostate surgery (in men)
- increase sexual sensation and orgasmic potential, and
- increase social confidence and quality of life.

Before starting a pelvic floor muscle training program it is important that you can identify your pelvic floor muscles correctly. Speak to a continence professional if you have difficulty identifying your pelvic floor muscles, are unsure if you are performing the exercises correctly or are continuing to experience bladder or bowel control symptoms.

It is best to have a continence professional assess your pelvic floor and develop an individualised pelvic floor muscle training program for you.

title: Pregnancy Pelvic Floor Plan
description:
An app to guide you through your pregnancy and beyond and maintain a healthy and functioning pelvic floor muscle. 

Features:
- Instructions on how to do pelvic floor muscle exercises
- Pelvic floor exercise reminders
- Timed personal pregnancy milestones related to your pelvic floor muscle health
- Tips to help you looking after your pelvic floor, bladder and bowel during pregnancy
- Information about pelvic floor muscle safe exercising
- Health and wellbeing tips to help you look after yourself
- Links and further information

Did you know 1 in 3 Australian women wet themselves after giving birth? In the majority of cases, urinary incontinence as a result of pregnancy and childbirth is preventable and treatable.

The Pregnancy Pelvic Floor Plan app aims to guide and inform pregnant women about pelvic floor muscle related issues throughout their pregnancy. It encourages regular pelvic floor muscle training, to help minimise the risk for women to be the one out of three Australian women experiencing incontinence after birth.
The app features tips on looking after your pelvic floor, bladder and bowel during pregnancy; instructions on how to do pelvic floor exercises and reminders to do them; information about safe exercise during and after pregnancy; health and wellbeing tips on looking after yourself; and useful links to find further information. The information in the app is divided into key pregnancy milestones, personalised reminders and further information.

This NEW and updated free Pregnancy Pelvic Floor Plan app was developed by the Continence Foundation of Australia in conjunction with The Pregnancy Centre and with input from women who are currently pregnant or have recently had a baby.

recentChanges: Alarm system improved for Android 6 above
comments: Great app. Really helps me to remember when to do my pelvic floor exercises and there is a lot of extra info in here that I wasn't expecting. Only one glitch that others have also identified, it doesn't always notify you but I have discovered you have to open the notifications and not just clear them by doing this, the app works perfectly.

As others have said it will go weeks without any notification and then suddenly several will come through randomly at the same time. Defeats the purpose of having the app when that is pretty much the sole purpose. I saw they replied to someone 12 months ago saying they're working on a fix. You would think after a year they would have come up with a fix by now...

The reminders stop working, or pile up suddenly. There is some very strange text on the introduction page that sounds like bad translation. The app is very hard to follow. It should be more intuitive. It keeps asking me to set it up.

The reminders stop working for me every three days, and only stay working again when I go bank into the app. I was constantly forgetting to do my exercises so I've just set reminders on my phone instead. Hopefully they can fix this.
Completely useless. I don't get a reminder for days and then they all come through at once.

title: Easy Kegel - Pelvic Floor Exercise
description:
The easiest and most effective way to strengthen your pelvic floor muscles!!

Do you find it hard to practice your kegel exercise? This app makes it easy with daily reminders and adjustable durations to suit you!

The app is suitable for both women and men who have problems connected to their bladder, bowels or pelvic floor muscles as it can be tailored to a specific exercise programme and set to remind you when to do your exercise. 

## Features

‚Ä¢ Easy to follow visual and optional audio or vibration cues
‚Ä¢ See your progress at a glance
‚Ä¢ Customisable reminders messages
‚Ä¢ Adjustable sessions lengths
‚Ä¢ Simple and clean interface

## Pro Features (In-App Purchase)

‚Ä¢ Background cues, hear audio or vibration cues even when the app is in background.
‚Ä¢ Multiple reminders and custom exercise sessions
‚Ä¢ Change app colour



## Discretion

Discreet icon and name so anyone looking at your phone won‚Äôt be able to see what the app is for

Silent mode, keep the phone in your pocket and have just the vibration as your prompt

Upgrade to use the app in background while you're using other apps!



## What is kegel exercise?

Kegel is an easy exercise that improves the sexual health of women and men, when done regularly. The exercise itself consists of contracting and releasing the pelvic floor muscle, also known as PC or PF muscle (the one you contract when holding urine), so you can do it anytime, anywhere!


## Kegel exercise Benefits

Kegel exercise has many benefits for both women and men:

‚Ä¢ Increases the blood flow to the genital area, hence, better erections for men.
‚Ä¢ Helps curing premature ejaculation (PE) and erectile Dysfunction (ED).
‚Ä¢ Helps curing Urinary incontinence or "leaking' of urine.
‚Ä¢ Increases the intensity of orgasms.
‚Ä¢ Makes childbirth easier, also restoring the vaginal area after giving birth.
‚Ä¢ Strengthens and reduces pain in the prostate & lowers the risk of having Hemorrhoids.
‚Ä¢ Increases overall pleasure during inter-course.


It‚Äôs free to download, so get it now!

comments: Great for those of us who forget we are doing Kegels and lose count! And you can adjust the Kegel sets to your ability. Love how it shows time spent on Kegels per day too. Haven't bought premium yet, but price seems reasonable to get more than one scheduled reminder a day if you're forgetful or don't feel like setting alarms on your phone. Also like the options on vibrate, bell, or no sound when it alternates between squeeze and rest.

Really good for allowing you to personalise your workout and track. Free version is good enough for me, you need to pay to get multiple reminds in the day but 1 is enough. Only thing that would make it better is if it gave guidance in what routine is needed.

I love the app... I've used it for just two weeks...I am pregnant and usually pee on myself while throwing but having used the app for just two weeks,I noticed I haven't peed on myself lately while throwing up. I am giving it 4stars because even after setting the alarm,it doesn't ever notify me, like i missed doing the exercise for two days cos I was busy, assuming I got an alarm,I won't have missed

This is the best kegel app I've found. After trying out a few, I found this is the easiest to use and it gives you gentle reminders on when to exercise (¬£1.99 to have more than 1 reminder a day, but definitely worth it). Perfect for those experiencing the craziness of baby brain and just want something simple, easy and effective.

Great app, which I use to prompt me while doing pelvic floor exercises while pregnant. I like the customisable options such as sound, vibrate and number of holds. Unfortunately the reminder does not seem to work. I have set it for 9pm each day but it never goes off, only goes off when I open the app anyway. Otherwise would be a 5 star worthy app.

title: DFree Personal
description: DFree¬Æ is the first wearable device to predict when you need to go the bathroom.  Designed primarily for seniors and people with disability who suffer from loss of bladder control, it continuously monitors your bladder and sends timely notifications to your phone when the bladder is almost full so you know when to go to the bathroom.  As a result, you no longer have to worry about accidents and can often forgo the embarrassment of wearing diapers. This device will also significantly reduce burden for caregivers who need to provide bathroom assistance.

title: T√§t - Pelvic Floor Exercises for Continence
description:
The T√§t app provides a pelvic floor muscle training programme in six basic and six advanced levels, information and advice. It contains help functions, the ability to create reminders, visualisation of each level of training, and a statistic function. It has been developed for treatment of stress urinary incontinence in women. The app is also used by many women for pelvic floor exercises during pregnancy and after delivery. It is available in English, Swedish, Arabic, Finnish, Spanish and German.

The effect of the mobile application has been evaluated in a study where 123 women were randomised to 3 months treatment with support of the smartphone application, or to a control group. Nine out of ten women in the app group improved, compared to two out of ten in the control group. For detailed results, see www.econtinence.se, under ‚ÄúPublications‚Äù.

In order to follow the use and the effect of treatment when the app is freely available, the app contains a few questions regarding age, gender, education, residence (urban or rural), pregnancy, and urinary leakage.  After three months there are follow-up questions regarding urinary leakage and exercises. Answering the questionnaires is voluntary, and entered data is anonymously transferred to the research database. The answers cannot be traced to a specific user or telephone number. The study is approved by the Regional Ethical Review Board, Ume√• University (Dnr 2014-389-32M, Dnr 2017-405-32M). More information at www.econtinence.se.
This app is CE-marked as a Class I medical device according to the EU regulation 2017/745 MDR

¬©T√§t.nu 2010-2020, T√§t¬Æ2020, Ume√• Sweden

comments: Excellent app... very easy to use (and my muscles are VERY weak from childbirth injuries and also due to a disease I have.) I found the information and instructions to be very informative. I feel that this is the best PF exercising app available here and would highly recommend it. And having got past the first non-intrusive questionnaire bit there are no adverts either, which is good. I highly recommend anyone to give this a go... (and I only write reviews for an app that impresses me ü§î‚ò∫üòä)

I love the app, it is done in a great detail and with a lot of effort. The instructions are nice and i love the explanations of how to find the right muscles (e.g. analogy with the zipper). The categorization of contractions also helps to implement them easier in every day life (it is not just simple kegels). Only thing regarding the questionnaire (not relevant for me but the developers) is that i could not identify myself with any of the options given for why i am using the app

The instructions are easy to follow, the strength scale is easy to follow and the reminders are easy to follow. And my problem is starting to get under control so I don't feel unease just for lifting my kid. Looking forward to completing the 3 months. I got this app as a suggestion from my midwife after suffering a rather extensive damage while giving birth. I could not figure out the instructions I got, via letter, by a physical therapist, and she came up with this.

Have tried a few pelvic floor exercise apps and this one is really good. No ads, no pressuring you to buy electronic aids to help you do your exercises. Advice as and when to do exercises and how to do them correctly. Would definitely recommend this app, and it's Free!!!

I got a recommendation to use the app by my physiotherapist, because I have a large injury in my pelvic floor (levator avulsion). The sound does not alway play correctly. The most disturbing is that old lady though. This is mocking all of us having injuries from giving birth. Most physiotherapists in Sweden recommend this app for these injuries we are certainly quite a few young women using this. Please change the background!(or give us an option!)

title: Kegel Exercises
description:
Kegel exercises can help prevent or control urinary incontinence and other pelvic muscle problems. Here is an application that explains how to do Kegel exercises correctly.
If you do Kegel exercises on a regular basis, then you can substantially strengthen your pelvic floor muscles. By having strong pelvic floor muscles, you may be able to reduce urinary and bowel incontinence and improve your sexual health. 

Kegel exercises help strengthen muscles that many factors can be weakened such as pregnancy, childbirth, surgery, aging and overweight.
This apps will teach you how to do Kegel exercises, which can help ward off pelvic floor problems, including urinary and fecal incontinence, and improve your sex life.
 
Kegel exercises can improve your sex life and help with pelvic floor problems, including urinary and fecal incontinence. The key is to get in the habit of doing them every day so you start to see results.

Kegel Exercises App provides all this Topic Full Information

title: Opro9 Adult SmartDiaper
description:
Designed for busy caregiver, it detects when a care recipient wets his or her diaper, and then notifies caregiver in a timely manner to change the diaper, keeping the care recipient more comfortable.
The Adult SmartDiaper wearable is a humidity and temperature sensing device. The device attaches to diapers via a velcro-like texturing on its soft, outer shell.
When a caregiver smart device is connected to the Adult SmartDiaper Wearable Sensor via App, caregiver can receive instant notifications about when a care recipient wets the diaper. This way caregiver can attend to their care recipient quickly.
App can connect to multiple sensors at one time, and provides:
‚Ä¢ Information on each care recipient's temperature and humidity levels
‚Ä¢ Notifications when a care recipient wets the diaper
‚Ä¢ Statistics on how often a care recipient pees, and how often the care recipient's diaper is getting changed
Opro9 Adult SmartDiaper is your high-tech assistant caretaker

title: Urological questionnaires
descriptionHTML:
The program includes a set of professional urological tests:
- I-PSS: International system of summary evaluation of diseases of the prostate;
- IIEF-5: International Index of Erectile Function;
- Bladder diary.

Do not interpret the results of these questionnaires as a diagnosis. The results of the questionnaires can be fully interpreted only by your attending physician. This application is intended only to make it convenient for you to fill in questionnaires/diaries data and send it to the doctor via email or messenger.
summary: Collection of urological questionnaires: I-PSS, IIEF-5, Diary of urination.

title: Rodger App ‚Äì Bedwetting training
description:
Rodger is the manufacturer of the most comfortable wireless bedwetting alarm of the
highest quality. The Rodger wireless bedwetting alarm system.
This Rodger app can be used free of charge by parents of children with a bedwetting
problem.
Create a profile for yourself and your child. Determine in the calendar when the bedwetting
training starts and fill in every morning whether it has been a dry or wet night.
You can then see the progress of the bedwetting training in the calendar.
Enter 9 rewards in the profile. For example, "eat pancakes with grandparents". These
rewards are linked to a badge that your child receives during the bedwetting training.

Easy and fast toilet diary to escape the worries of constipation.

By knowing whether bowel movements are regular or not

title: Healthy Bladder-Voiding Diary
description:
If you have hard time peeing or have been seeing an increase in "gotta go" urgency feeling, check your bladder health through 72-hour voiding diary!

** Your first step to a healthier bladder - Voiding Diary **

Having a voiding diary can be helpful because it describes your daily habits, your urinary symptoms and demonstrates how they are affecting your life.

The diary helps keep track of when and how much you urinate, and how often you have that ‚Äúgotta go‚Äù urgency feeling.

Start tracking with just your smartphone - no additional hardware necessary!


WHY YOU WILL LOVE SOUNDABLE DIARY:
1. It's easy peesy! - Stand in front of the toilet, unzip, and let nature take its course. Our app will take care of the rest.
2. It's battle-tested! - this diary uses the technology clinically validated in multiple sites. We analyzed over 35,000 cases of pee from 4,700 people. 
3. Act fast! - Understanding your urinary symptoms means that you can fear less and act fast to seek professional care. Get on with your life with SOUNDABLE DIARY


HOW TO USE
1. (Man)Stand in front of the toilet
(Woman)Sit on the toilet and spread your knees shoulder-width apart.
2. (Man) Keep your phone 3 feet away. Point the bottom of your phone toward the toilet.
(Woman) Sit back a little, hold your phone in your hand and place it on your lap
3. Press 'Start' to begin measurement 
4. Make sure to aim for the water (not the sides!)


DEVICE  
Best performance on 
Samsung Galaxy S series: S8, S8+, S9, S9+, S10e, S10, S10+, S10 5G
Samsung Galaxy Note series: Note8, Note9(only Male), Note10 5G, Note10+ 5G


IMPORTANT NOTICE 
This is not a medical device, and services are provided for informational purposes only. The services are not intended to be, and should not be taken to be, nor do they replace, (I) professional medical advice, screening, diagnosis, or treatment, (II) the practice of medicine, or (III) the provision of medical care. The service is not designed to be a substitute for clinical examination equipment or diagnosis. Please do not rely on the results provided by the app to assess your health; instead, you should consult with your doctors or another qualified healthcare professional in all matters relating to your health.
Please carefully review the terms of use and privacy policy before you start using proudP. 

Terms of Use : https://www.soundablehealth.com/diary-terms-of-use
Privacy Policy : https://www.soundablehealth.com/privacy-policy


CONTACT
For more information, visit soundablehealth.com
For question and feedback, drop us a line at support@soundablehealth.com

title: Offroad Transport Truck Simulator:Truck Drive 2019
description:
Get ready for up hill truck driving experience. Offroad Transport Truck Simulator:Truck Drive 2019 is a trailer truck simulator and an offroad truck simulator is specially designed for the people who are looking for truck drifting games, big truck games and transporter games. This is offroad truck hill driving and you are performing a role of an offroad truck transporter, so drive this heavy truck and other heavy vehicle carefully like a real driver and enjoy cargo truck simulation. Careful driving is necessary while driving this hill truck. Take part in hill climb training as you have to experience hill driving. Move trailers to transport cargo while playing this cargo transport simulator.

Offroad Transport Truck Simulator:Truck Drive 2019 is a cargo truck sim and 3d truck driver offroad game for a real mountain driver and hill climb truck lovers. Being a truck expert you may have to assign duties of an army truck driver. You may have to drive pak army cargo truck and army oil truck to perform army carriage duty. You can use heavy loader trucks or design your truck yourself to meet cargo transportation requirements but be careful of handling truck speed in these hilly areas and mountains as sometimes you may have to deal with busted brakes. Keep in mind that you are not performing a role of a conductor, your duty is to drive truck and big truck driving is not as much easy as simple truck parking.

Superheroz Action is back with their brand new game "Offroad Transport Truck Simulator:Truck Drive 2019" loaded with a cargo truck, an offroad truck, truck delivery and truck driving experience.

Different environment of truck driving. 
Extreme precision 3D truck simulation.
Great energetic and smooth gameplay.
Awesome multiple driving controls of truck.

comments: My true purpose for trying this app was to help with digestive issues I've experienced for the past two years. Figured, why not? This helps! Matter of fact, I would rate it top 3 of what is putting my system back on track. I've been using this app for about 8 months now and I absolutely love it. As of right now, at almost 50 and normal weight, my pelvic muscles are on point. ( Sorry if that sounds awkward.) This app keeps me focused and, oftentimes, I meditate through these exercises.

Simple, effective. This has 2 simple types of Kegel exercises, performed after each other. It builds repetition and time slowly each day. Perfect for post hysterectomy. It gives a discreet reminder on my phone. I have the app set to vibrate times during exercises so I can close my eyes and concentrate rather than counting or watching clock. I HIGHLY recommend.

I love this I have tried doing legal excercise on my own but would not feel like I was doing them correctly. This app shows me how to make progress. I have been doing this for about a week and can feel the muscles getting a little toner I guess you would say. I am not sure how to say it. I just feel it working

I like the exercises in this app for basic squeeze-release kegels, and that they slowly progress each day without you having to advanced them, much as a personal trainer would do. My only two gripes so far after using it for a few days, and why it fell short of five stars, are that I wish there was at count down before beginning the exercises like 3-2-1-go, and I wish you could set reminders to do the exercises multiple times a day.
Ads are not intrusive at all. Design of app good. Can do anywhere and noone knows what you're doing. The graph is encouraging to try and get yourself up the levels! Straightforward; thank you!

title: TheraPee
description:
THERAPEE‚Ñ¢ is a combination of an advanced bedwetting alarm brought together with state-of-the-art, web-based interactive software. The system is based on over 30 years of professional research and practical application.
Integrating the experience of treating over 40,000 children and young adults and research involving patients aging from 4 to 35, the THERAPEE‚Ñ¢ system is designed to provide that same level of effective bedwetting therapy to patients all around the world. Via the internet and the interactive portal we‚Äôve created, you will receive a personalized level of care while never having to leave your home ‚Äì and at a fraction of the cost that would typically be required for this level of service.

Our THERAPEE‚Ñ¢ program is tailor-made for each user based on the information you and your child supply.
Upon ordering, you‚Äôll be provided with an activation code that will allow access to our ‚Äúvirtual chart‚Äù which individually follows your child‚Äôs progress and offers tailored advice and encouragement.
The first time you log in to the program, you‚Äôll meet your treatment therapist in a series of short video clips. These clips guide you and your child through the process of howTHERAPEE‚Ñ¢ works and what you will be doing until the bedwetting properly is completely resolved  - all from the comfort and privacy of your home.
Every two weeks a consultation session is provided with the online treatment therapist. In these sessions, the progress or status of your treatment is monitored and you will be given special exercises to help increase bladder capacity or strengthen the muscles needed to achieve dry nights.
Alongside the online program, we have included FAQs, so that all questions and issues that one could face during a bedwetting treatment are clearly answered by our video clips. Of course, should you have a question not covered in the video section, we are more than happy to consult by email or phone.

title: FI Stool Diary
description:
¬©Neurogut 2018   FECAL INCONTINENCE STOOL DIARY INSTRUMENT
Basic description: The Fecal Incontinence Stool Diary Instrument (FISDI) is a list of patient-reported symptoms for the evaluation of accidental stool leakage also known as fecal Incontinence, and other bowel problems associated with this condition. Fecal incontinence affects 9% of the adult US population and at least 25% of nursing home residents. Fecal incontinence is associated with multiple bowel and stool-related symptoms. Because of the irregular and unpredictable nature of bowel habit, including accidental loss of stool and or gas, and difficulty with either remembering or recalling these symptoms, a prospective assessment of patient-reported bowel and stooling-related symptoms is important, both for use in clinical trials, and for the assessment of patients with fecal incontinence.
Authors:
Neurogut Incorporated (USA)
Objective:
To assess the presence and severity of patient-reported bowel, stool and abdominal symptoms related to accidental stool leakage (fecal incontinence), for use in clinical trials, and assessment of patients with fecal incontinence
Therapeutic Areas:
Gastrointestinal and Digestive System Diseases
Pathological conditions, Signs and Symptoms
Therapeutic indications:
Fecal Incontinence
Dyssynergic defecation
Anorectal and Colorectal diseases
Urinary incontinence
Pelvic floor problems
Type of Clinical Outcome Assessment (COA)
Patient Reported Outcome (PRO) assessment
Original language
English for the USA
Bibliographic reference for the original questionnaire:
Rao SSC. Diagnosis and Management of Fecal Incontinence. Am J Gastroenterol 2004; 99: 
1585-1604.


FECAL INCONTINENCE STOOL DIARY INSTRUMENT (FISDI)
This questionnaire enquires about your problem with accidental stool leakage or fecal incontinence, and its severity over 7 days. Please answer all questions as accurately as possible. For each day and for each question presented in this app, please respond that best describes your bowel and abdominal symptoms with each bowel movement and/or with each episode of stool leakage or fecal incontinence, and rate its severity.

title: Kegel Master - Kegel Trainer
description:
Kegel Talent - personal trainer for performing Kegel exercises for free.
In the app, you will find an advanced schedule of Kegel exercises for women and men that will help you strengthen your pelvic floor muscles. Just a few minutes a day! 

What is a Kegel exercise?
Kegel exercises classic - Kegel gymnastics exercise to strengthen the pelvic floor muscles, exercise improves improves the sex life of men and women, the work of the bladder, prevents the omission of pelvic organs.

Don't know how to do Kegel exercises?
Our app contains complete instructions for performing Kegel exercises in the Kegel talent app. Don't worry, we'll explain everything to you!

Why do a Kegel exercise?

Kegel exercises for men:
- Increasing sexual opportunities.
- Strengthening men's health.
- Improving the functioning of the bladder and preventing urinary incontinence.
- Reducing the risk of prostatitis.
- Improving the quality of sexual life.
- Prevention of erectile dysfunction and premature ejaculation.

Kegel exercises for women:
- Kegel exercises for pregnant women are very useful.
- Improving the quality of sexual life.
- Strengthening women's health.
- Benefits during pregnancy and after childbirth.
- Increase the intensity of orgasms and overall pleasure during sexual intercourse.
- Reducing pain during labor and reducing the time of delivery.
- Accelerated recovery after childbirth and after pregnancy.
- Prevention and treatment of pelvic organ prolapse.
- Kegel will reduce pain for women during childbirth.



Main features of the app:


Don't want anyone to see what you do? Silent mode!
Enable Silent mode in the app settings. The app will tell you how to do exercises using vibration, without the knowledge of others.


Advanced Personal Kegel exercise trainer

- Guide for performing exercises.

- Training reminders. ( Kegel reminder-Daily reminders will help you not miss a workout)


Install the app with Kegel exercises right now for FREE!

title: Discreetly Fit
description:
The Discreetly Fit app is designed to support the participants of the 30 Day Pelvic Floor Reform in staying active in pelvic floor care. This result oriented practise program focuses on optimising pelvic floor function including bladder control, pelvic organ support and core strength. The Discreetly Fit app allows participants to:

- Log their pelvic floor muscle training sessions
- Practice the Discreetly Fit Training with voice guidance
- Enjoy our Pelvic Floor Bliss relaxation
- Consult the milestone schedule of the program and
- Receive Discreetly Fit tips & messages.

The Discreetly Fit program is committed to bring you the following essential elements of pelvic floor care:

- the best pelvic floor muscle training technique for women
- reliable research based information
- protective and functional pelvic floor skills for everyday living
- enhanced pelvic floor knowledge, awareness and connection and
- motivation and support to make pelvic floor care a life-time practice.

title: Kegel Guide
description:
Kegel exercises, also known as pelvic floor muscle training, are simple squeeze and release exercises for your pelvic floor muscles to help make them stronger.

A weak pelvic floor may cause issues such as not being able to control your bowels or bladder. So, doing kegels can help improve urinary incontinence. Both men and women can do pelvic floor exercises.

Many factors can cause the pelvic floor in women to weaken such as pregnancy, childbirth, aging and weight gain. Men also experience this as well due to aging or if the man has had prostrate surgery. 

Kegel Guide provides you with the basic tools to help you complete your kegel exercises.  With Kegel Guide, you will get an easy to use interface, an area to set up your weekly / daily unlimited reminders, a progress tracker,  and a set of audio and visual guides to help you conveniently complete your workout anytime and anywhere.

The kegel exercises can also be done hands-free by starting the timer and listening to the audio guides.

Features

‚Ä¢ Set the speed and duration of the timer.
‚Ä¢ Select audio, visual or vibration guides to help you complete your workout. 
‚Ä¢ Set daily / weekly reminders.

If you have, any comments, questions, or concerns, please contact us at appincept@gmail.com.

comments: GREAT APP!!! I downloaded three Kegel apps for testing and evaluation to ascertain which would suit my needs. After a week, this was by far the best. Good user customized exercise intervals with preset times and adjustable sets. Since using it for some six weeks, it has greatly improved my health where Kegel exercises are concerned. I highly recommend it for your Kegel exercise needs for both men and women.

This is the best app I have found to support doing pelvic floor exercises. Enough flexibility for me to choose exactly what I need in the settings with the duration and the number of reps etc. Only thing missing is the option to have accompanying music, however you can have spotify going at the same time.

I really like this app! Have had pelvic floor pain, go to pf phys therapy. simple reminders that pop up on your screen on the icon and that you could vary the different sets you need to do. I told my physical therapist about it, shes spreading the word also about this app. You can also vary the counting by vibe, belltone, or spoken. Vibe count is best for me. thank you

The best Kegel exercise app I found so far. After using for just one week I contributed and removed ads which I never even noticed anyhow, but wanted to support the app. Nice, clean easy to use interface and reminders. Everything is totally and quickly customizable.
Simple interface, streamlined features, and uncluttered appearance. The only way I could see the app improving would be a way to customize color options. An all-around near perfect app.

title: Kegel exercise - Kegel trainer
description:
Kegel exercises make your pelvic floor muscles stronger. These muscles control your urine flow and help hold your pelvic organs in place.

Doctors often prescribe Kegels for:

Stress incontinence . This means leaking urine when you laugh, cough, sneeze, jog, or lift something heavy.
Urge incontinence . This is a need to urinate that is so strong you can't reach the toilet in time.
Pelvic floor weakness due to childbirth. Childbirth can stretch and weaken pelvic floor muscles. And that can cause urine control problems. It can also allow one or more pelvic organs to sag. When the uterus sags, it's called uterine prolapse. Women can help prevent this problem by doing daily Kegels during and after pregnancy.

How to do Kegel exercises

Kegels are easy to do and can be done anywhere without anyone knowing.
Find the muscles you use to stop urinating.
Squeeze these muscles for 3 seconds. Then relax for 3 seconds. Your stomach and thigh muscles should not tighten when you do this.
Add 1 second each week until you are able to squeeze for 10 seconds each time.
Repeat this exercise 10 to 15 times per session. Try to do this at least 3 times a day.
Don't do Kegels while you urinate. Doing them during urination can hurt your bladder.
Kegels work best when done on a regular schedule.

Your doctor may want you to try doing Kegels with biofeedback. It lets you to see, feel, or hear when an exercise is being done correctly.

Talk to your doctor if you don't notice improvement after doing Kegels for 3 or 4 months.

title: Kegel Talent
description:
Kegel exercises make the muscles under the uterus, bladder, and bowel stronger. They can help prevent or control urinary incontinence and other pelvic floor problems. 

Kegels work best when doing on a regular schedule. Try to do this at least 3 times a day and continue the Kegels daily as a lifelong habit.

Kegel Talent APP is designed with default exercises for beginners. Once you've acquired adequate strength in your muscles, you can setup the APP to take bigger exercises.

Main functions of Kegel Talent:

[TODAY]
* Select Kegel trainer program, press 'Start' button, follow the screen instruction to perform Kegel exercise.
* There are several exercise sessions per day in a Kegel training. After each session, take sufficient rest.
* Each exercise session can be canceled anytime. The cancelled session will not be recorded in today's record.

[RECORD]
* Each finished Kegel exercise session will be recorded for your reference.
* Days with Kegel exercises will be indicated by color. Green >= 3 exercises; Yellow < 3 exercises; Red = Today's record.
* Press 'Delete' button will remove the current selected record. Delete today's record will reset today.

[USAGE]
* This APP is suitable for both male and female users. Follow the introduction on the APP while doing Kegel exercise. 
* The usage guide describes Kegel exercise using men as the example. Female users can search internet for the knowledge related to women.
* Every time, click the banner ads on the screen, you can remove the ads and get a 3-day free use of all functions in the APP.

title: Emy - Medical Kegel exercises
description:
Emy is a free mobile application: an effective and easy way to strengthen your pelvic floor muscles! You can do your pelvic floor re-education wherever and whenever you want, with or without the device.

Train and tone your pelvic floor with fun Kegel exercises. 5-minute sessions are enough to strengthen your pelvic floor. Access your progress graph and schedule reminders so you do not forget to exercise!

To go further in your self-training, discover the wireless device Emy, entirely made in France.
You can buy the device on fizimed.com üòâ.

This medical innovation is connected to the application and allows you to have a real-time feedback on your contractions thanks to the technology of biofeedback. You will access 20 mini-games in 5 different worlds to stay motivated.

Designed by and for women, Kegel exercises are based on therapeutic protocols used by pelvic floor experts. The Emy device has been developed in collaboration with healthcare professionals: benefit from a personalized program adjusted to your profile! An intuitive interface allows you to follow the evolution of your physical indicators and your progress.
Our users are extremely satisfied since they see the first effects only after 3 weeks of use! So do not wait, take control of your pelvic floor, stop your urinary leaks and regain confidence in yourself!

Scientific and educational content helps to better understand the pelvic floor and urinary incontinence. Also access many tips written by health professionals specialized in pelvic floor re-education for more effective self-training. The pelvic floor will have no more secrets for you!

description:
The Signs & Symptoms Urinary Incontinence helps the patients to self-manage Urinary Incontinence, using interactive tools. This app gives the patient important information regarding signs and symptoms of Urinary Incontinence and management of the disease.This app also allows the patient to record and track Urinary Incontinence levels along time with an incredible graphing option. The patient can show these records to the doctor and together improve the patient‚Äôs quality of life.  This app also allows the patient to remember when and which medication to take to manage Urinary Incontinence. 

Besides, the user can test its knowledge regarding Urinary Incontinence in an amusing way through a little and funny quiz. 

Some information provided may not be valid for residents of other countries due to variations in medical practice and drug approval and indications.

This patient education application provides patients and Health Care Practitioners with easy to access information on Urinary Incontinence management.

title: Kegel Exercises for Men & Women - A How-to Guide
description:
How to Do Kegel Exercises for Men
If you do Kegel exercises on a regular basis, then you can substantially strengthen your pelvic floor muscles. By having strong pelvic floor muscles, you may be able to reduce urinary and bowel incontinence and improve your sexual health.[1] Before you begin practicing the exercises regularly, you must learn how to do them correctly. If you are unsure, then contact your doctor. Like any exercise, start out slowly and gradually increase your stamina over time.Do Kegel exercises before receiving treatment for prostate cancer.

How to Do Pelvic Floor Exercises
The pelvic floor is a group of muscles--in both men and women--that support your spine, help control your bladder, and help with sexual functions. By identifying your pelvic floor, performing Kegels (a popular pelvic floor exercise), and practicing other pelvic floor exercises, you can rehabilitate these muscles. In time, you can gain the benefits of a strong pelvic floor, including reduced urinary incontinence, less back pain, more control of your core, and better sex.

How to Do Kegel Exercises for Women
Kegel exercises can improve your sex life and help with pelvic floor problems, including urinary and fecal incontinence. The key is to get in the habit of doing them every day so you start to see results.

Kegel Exercise Description and Routines
Basic Kegel Exercise Descriptions
Beginner Kegel Exercise Routine
Intermediate Kegel Exercise Routine

How to Do Reverse Kegels
Kegels are well known for their ability to tighten the pelvic floor, reduce incontinence, improve sexual enjoyment, and help with childbirth. Reverse kegels can also help with these goals. Each time you do a reverse kegel, you relax, lengthen, and stretch the pelvic floor, which may help to relieve pain or tension in the area. Men and women can perform reverse kegels, and you can do them anywhere without any special equipment!

How to Do Kegel Exercises for Pregnant Women
Kegel exercises, like other exercises, help strengthen muscles. The muscles that are strengthened by the Kegel exercises are located in the lower section of the pelvic region and are responsible for holding the pelvic organs in place as well as controlling the flow of urine from the body.[1] Both of these are important for pregnant women. Due to the increased size of the uterus and the weight of the growing baby, this area of the body is under stress, which can sometimes lead to bladder leakage and other issues, To do Kegel exercises, you will need to find the muscles and then practice engaging them.

How to Treat and Prevent Incontinence with Kegel Exercises
Kegel exercises can strengthen a woman's pelvic muscles and ligaments. For best results, more than three sets of Kegel exercises should be done every day.

How to Do PC Muscle Exercises
The pubococcygeus (PC) muscle is the muscle that stretches from your pubic bone to the bottom of your spine. Strengthening the pubococcygeus (PC) muscle can help both sexes treat urinary and fecal incontinence, as well. PC muscle exercises are easy daily exercises that will help strengthen your PC muscle.

Kegel exercises: A how-to guide for women
Here's a step-by-step guide to doing Kegel exercises correctly.

Kegel exercises for men: Understand the benefits
Kegel exercises for men can help improve bladder control 

Kegel exercises (also called ‚Äúpelvic floor exercises‚Äù) strengthen your pelvic floor muscles.

What are Kegel exercises?
Why do Kegel exercises?

The muscles that are strengthened by the Kegel exercises are located in the lower section of the pelvic region and are responsible for holding the pelvic organs in place as well as controlling the flow of urine from the body.[1] Both of these are important for pregnant women. Due to the increased size of the uterus and the weight of the growing baby, this area of the body is under stress, which can sometimes lead to bladder leakage and other issues, To do Kegel exercises, you will need to find the muscles and then practice engaging them.

How to Treat and Prevent Incontinence with Kegel Exercises
Kegel exercises can strengthen a woman's pelvic muscles and ligaments. For best results, more than three sets of Kegel exercises should be done every day.

How to Do PC Muscle Exercises
The pubococcygeus (PC) muscle is the muscle that stretches from your pubic bone to the bottom of your spine. Strengthening the pubococcygeus (PC) muscle can help both sexes treat urinary and fecal incontinence, as well. PC muscle exercises are easy daily exercises that will help strengthen your PC muscle.

Kegel exercises: A how-to guide for women
Here's a step-by-step guide to doing Kegel exercises correctly.

Kegel exercises for men can help improve bladder control

title: T√§t III ‚ÄìPelvic Floor Exercises for men
description:
T√§t¬ÆIII is intended to support men with pelvic floor exercises in cases where these kinds of exercises have been recommended by medical staff.  Urine leakage upon coughing, jumping or sneezing ‚Äì stress incontinence ‚Äì is common after an operation for prostate cancer (radical prostatectomy). It is recommended that pelvic floor exercises start before the operation is performed, and that the exercises continue after the operation. 

The T√§t¬ÆIII app provides a pelvic floor muscle training programme in six basic and six advanced levels, with increasing severity. Four different kinds of ‚Äúcontractions‚Äù are described. The app includes visual aids for each level of training, a statistics function and the ability to create reminders. The app also includes information about the pelvic floor, prostate cancer operations and urinary incontinence. There is information about factors that affect incontinence. 

Studies have shown that urine leakage problems can decrease more rapidly with the help of pelvic floor exercises. The T√§t¬ÆIII app has been shown to facilitate these exercises. The T√§t¬ÆIII app builds upon the T√§t¬Æ for women, which has been evaluated in several studies with positive results for the treatment of stress urinary incontinence, see www.econtinence.se

In order to follow the use, there are questions integrated into the app regarding age, gender, education, residence (urban or rural), prostate operations, and urinary leakage. After one month there are follow-up questions regarding urinary leakage and exercises and it is possible to comment about the app. Three months after download follow-up questions regarding urinary leakage, exercises and the app are repeated. Answering the questionnaires is voluntary, and entered data is anonymously transferred to the research database. The answers cannot be traced to a specific user or telephone number. The Ethics Review Board in Ume√• has issued an advisory opinion, stating that they do not see any ethical problem with this study.

The T√§t¬ÆIII app is CE-marked as a Class I medical device according to the EU regulation 2017/745 MDR.

¬©T√§t.nu 2010-2020, T√§t¬Æ2020, Ume√•, Sweden

title: Bed Wetting Home Remedy
description: Nocturnal enuresis, also called bedwetting, is involuntary urination while asleep after the age at which bladder control usually occurs. Nocturnal enuresis is considered primary (PNE) when a child has not yet had a prolonged period of being dry. Secondary nocturnal enuresis (SNE) is when a child or adult begins wetting again after having stayed dry.

title: Hydrocephalus Disease
description: Hydrocephalus is a condition in which there is an accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) within the brain. This typically causes increased pressure inside the skull. Older people may have headaches, double vision, poor balance, urinary incontinence, personality changes, or mental impairment. In babies there may be a rapid increase in head size. Other symptoms may include vomiting, sleepiness, seizures, and downward pointing of the eyes. Hydrocephalus can occur due to birth defects or be acquired later in life. Associated birth defects include neural tube defects and those that result in aqueductal stenosis. Other causes include meningitis, brain tumors, traumatic brain injury, intraventricular hemorrhage, and subarachnoid hemorrhage. There are four types of hydrocephalus: communicating, non-communicating, ex-vacuo, and normal pressure. Diagnosis is typically made by examination and medical imaging.

title: Bedwetting Diary
description:
Bedwetting Diary is for storing daily records of child's behavior for the treatment.
You can manage one or more children separetly and see all the records with a table sheet. Switch the table display to daily, weekly and monthly.
Just tapping behavior icons to store records. It is so simple. Dry and wet icons will be displayed on the calendar so you can understand the behaivor at a glance.
You can send the table sheet as a CSV file by email and retrieve data in a spreadsheet software.		
ÔºäBedwetting Diary does not sync with Google Calendar.	

Bedwetting Diary Howto Guide

ÔºäMenu Button of the PhoneÔºä
1. Search:Search the records by a keyword.
2. Import SD card: Import data from SD card.
3. Export SD card: Export data to SD card.
4. Export Cloud:You can backup data to Google Drive and Dropbox.ÔºäPlease install either software from the market.
6. Copy to SD card: Copy the data to internal and external SD card.
7. Password: Set the password.
8. Recovery: Use this function when you want to return to the previous data. ÔºäPlease note that the current data will be deleted when you use this function.

ÔºäAdd child namesÔºä
You can save one or more child names and manage the records separately for each child.
1. Launch Enuresis Diary. Opening screen is "Add" window.
2. Enter the name, select a photo, sex and birthday‚Üítap "Save" and return to the calendar.
3. You can add more names, edit and select the name by tapping the top-right square button of the calendar. 
4. Selected child name is displayed on the title bar.

ÔºäHow to save daily recordsÔºä
1. Tap Ôºã ("Add") button of the calendar.
2. Move to Daily To-Do.
„Éº„ÉºAction Tag„Éº„Éº
3. Action tag is selected. Tap behavior icons to save records.
4. Let's save first "Dry" or "Wet"  for the day. The seleted icon from those will be displayed on the calendar so that you can understand the behavior at a glance.
5. Save records by tapping each icon. After saving records, the saved data will be appeared below the calendar.
6. A long press to edit the behavior icons. Move to edit window.
ÔºúEdit window's buttonsÔºû
Pencil buttonÔºöAfter editing all the data tap pencil button to save.
Back buttonÔºöReturn to Daily To-Do.
Delete buttonÔºöDelete the behavior icon.
„Éº„ÉºCondition Tag„Éº„Éº
1. Tap Condition tag.
2. Sleeping hours will be calculated when there are entries of wake-up and bed time.
3. Tap face marks to save bed time mood of the child.
4. You can use a memo as a journal.
5. Return to the calendar by pressing „ÄåBack„Äçbutton of the mobile phone.

ÔºäButtons of the calendarÔºä
From top
---top right---
1. „ÄåHelp„Äçbutton: Move to this description web page of GalleryApp.
2. „ÄåMarket„Äçbutton:ÔºöRecommendation of other GalleryApp's apps.
---below Help and Market button---
3. „ÄåAdd„ÄçbuttonÔºöAdd, edit and select the name of the child.
---middle right of the calendar---
4. „ÄåList„Äçbutton: Switch to a list display.
5. „ÄåWeekly„Äçbutton: Switch to a weekly display.
---middle of the calendar---
6. „ÄåArrow„ÄçÔºöSwitch the display. You can see the list in a full screen.
Bottom of the calendar
---from left^---
7. „ÄåAdd„ÄçbuttonÔºöSave daily records of the child.
8. „ÄåToday„Äçbutton: Go back to today's date.
9. „ÄåLeft„Äç„ÄåRight„Äçbutton: Move dates right and left.„ÄÇ
10.„ÄåGraph„ÄçbuttonÔºöYou can see graphs of each behavior.
11. „ÄåTable„ÄçbuttonÔºöYou can see the data with table sheet.

ÔºäTable sheetÔºä
RowÔºöDate
ColumnÔºöTime

1. Dry or Wet of the day.
2. The sum of urination he/she holded.

title: Carin Pelvic Floor Trainer
description:
***   IMPORTANT   ***

For a complete experience, you need a Carin sensor.

************

Carin Pelvic Floor Trainer is a core training program that helps you regain control over your pelvic floor muscles. This app tracks your activity, liquid intake and all the while keeps you motivated. The exercises are fun, brief and easily accessible with a special focus on the integration of pelvic floor training within daily life.

Carin Pelvic Floor Trainer follows 3 basic principles:
1. Feel your pelvic floor muscles
2. Coordinate your pelvic floor muscles in daily life
3. Strengthen your back, core and pelvic floor muscles

During the pelvic floor exercise program, you are supported by Carin Protect, a beautiful absorbing underwear. Currently the app works only together with the Carin sensor. After downloading the app you will be asked to sync the sensor to proceed with the training. 

Carin is a wearable technology solution born from the philosophy to empower women‚Äôs everyday. Carin is designed for women who have recently given birth to exercise their pelvic floor muscles. A social taboo yet a super common condition, we know that mild incontinence impacts your life.

Carin is created by LifeSense Group. We bring medical technology to the consumer market and improve consumer products for medical use. By offering the tools to understand and improve one‚Äôs condition, we bring back sense of life!

title: LoFric Mic Chart
description: This simple chart allows you to record the fluid you drink and the urine you pass over two or three days (48/72 hours). This can provide valuable information about your bladder situation. When completed, bring or email the chart to the appointment with your doctor or nurse.
descriptionHTML: This simple chart allows you to record the fluid you drink and the urine you pass over two or three days (48/72 hours). This can provide valuable information about your bladder situation. When completed, bring or email the chart to the appointment with your doctor or nurse.
summary: This allows you to record fluid intake and the urine you pass over 48/72 hours.
comments: A simple app that does more or less what it promises. Could easily be made better and more useful with some simple additions / modifications: 1. Instead of a special note entry (or in addition to it), make it possible to add a comment (or note) to each event (intake, voiding a.s.o.). 2. Let people change the standard intake measures to something that suits them better (add a "settings" part for this and maybe other defaults) 3. (As another user suggested) add a running total functionality for both intake and voiding. 4. I didn't find any use for the distinction of 48 and 72. You start when you want and end when you want. 5. Report: Remove the unnecessary "ml" near every entry (we know its not liters), and make it more useful in Excel.
So glad i found this app. One improvement i would make us to have running total of intake to help those on target amount.
Simple does the job

title: Miction Calendar - Bladder diary
description:
Calendario Micci√≥n - Miction Calendar, allows you keep a detailed diary of mictions on your smartphone, so you can note down it anywhere, anytime, no need to use papers

This application was designed to help people who have urinary problems, pelvic floor diseases, pregnant women and more, they could manage their micturitions.

It allows to add records of the micturitions all necessary data, like date and time, quantities ingested and urinated, level of urgency or extra observations.

Also, you could check all your records with a handy calendar that lets you visualize them easily.

In addition, you could see tables with averages and totals, moreover you would have an option to filter on the dates you indicate, and export these data to PDF and print them or send them to your healthcare staff and this way, you will be able to reduce urine losses.
